context: In 2005, Autodesk was a dominant force in computer-aided design (CAD) software, known primarily for its flagship AutoCAD product. Founded in 1982, the company served architecture, engineering, construction, manufacturing, media, and entertainment industries. The CAD software market was competitive with several established vendors offering 2D drafting, 3D modeling, and design visualization tools. Autodesk competed across multiple segments including mechanical design, building design, and digital media creation.
